question: Well, it's okay. You didn't tell me it was monsoon season going out.
answer: Hey, buenos dias, cowboy. When d'you blow in?

question: Just got back. Missed anything?
answer: Ahh, don't pay any attention to Urioste. She's still pissed that Noguchi wouldn't let her go off on your hunting trip.

question: Wasn't my trip, I just did the driving. 'Sides, freezing my butt off out in the wet taking pot-shots at the local wildlife isn't my idea of a good time, either.
answer: Where'd you leave them?

question: Camped out by the navi-beacon out on Linson's Range. They're making their own way back tomorrow.
answer: MarsCo went belly-up on the Dow Jones.

question: Shit. When?
answer: Yesterday. We got the Network feed from Gateway; it was the top story on 'Sixty Seconds'. Biggest market crash since twenty-four.

question: Fucking great. I invested some money in them.
answer: You win some, you loose some.

question: I lose 'em all, that's why I'm still out here on this rock. Anything else you wanna ruin my day with?
answer: No, but I got something that might interest you.

question: Crazy idiots.
answer: Ahhh, they're just letting off some steam; don't let 'em get to you. Ackland and York aren't such bad guys when you get to know 'em. Just a couple of weekend warriors... Nice howitzer you've got there.

question: Thanks.
answer: Good argument for gun-control. What are you going after, rhino?

question: Hey, boss. Wondered where you'd gotten to.
answer: I just... wanted to be put on my own for a while. Clear my head.

question: Didn't feel like whoopin' it up with the rest of us blue collars, huh?
answer: I've got a lot of thinking to do. 'Sides, the room was getting too crowded for me.

question: Not too much of the socializing type, then?
answer: No, not really. More sort of the 'claustrophobic' type. I'm serious. That's why I switched from orbiting to planetary installations.

question: Is that a fact.
answer: Uh-huh. Used to get it pretty bad. I'd wake up in a cold sweat and want to claw open a vacuum hatch.

question: How long you been out here for now, anyway? Three months?
answer: Four.

question: And before that?
answer: Six month stint on Datus.

question: Only six?
answer: What is this? 'Twenty Questions'?

question: Just curious. There's a lot of talk goes around.
answer: I don't know. I guess I've just never found anywhere I really felt at home.

question: What is that?
answer: Real man' drink.

question: Seltzer?
answer: Want some?

question: I'll stick with my own.
answer: Any luck raising Ackland's party?

question: Nothing. With the satellite down, we can't transmit over the mountain range. He's most likely sitting there wondering why he can't raise us.
answer: First light, we'll take a chopper out there and tell them to head back.

question: 'We'? You wanna fly out there with me?
answer: Sure. Do me good to stretch my legs. This whole thing's got me spooked.

question: Don't worry about it. If the Network goes by the book, like everyone figures they will, a Marine gunboat from Powell'll drop-by for a look- see in four-or-five days. They can go poke around out there and find whatever it was hit us. All we've gotta do is sit tight.
answer: Do you think Ackland'll sit tight?

question: Found anything?
answer: Nada. No radiation... no movement... nothing.

question: Well, just keep looking. It's gotta be... whoa, Jesus!
answer: What is it?

question: It's a rhino.
answer: Is it dead?

question: No, it's still breathing. Kinda clammy though. Are you sure your stick's not broken.
answer: Yeah, it's fine.

question: God, I hope that thing didn't bring down a virus.
answer: I told you we... what's that?

question: Looks like a spore. Fungus of some kind, maybe?
answer: Bloody big if it is. Top's open. Careful...

question: It's hollow. Think our rhino must've ate something that didn't agree with him.
answer: Let's get back and call this in.

question: Wait a minute.
answer: What is that... is that metal fragments?

question: This is very fucking weird. It's like something came out of the crater and went that way...
answer: Another one?

question: Yeah. This's closed.
answer: Oh, God; oh, shit; oh, God.

question: Oh, God; oh, shit; oh, God.
answer: Jesus Christ! What happened?

question: Give me a hand with Ack.
answer: How bad is... oh my God. What is that?

question: Don't... uuh... don't know. Help me... uuh... help me get him inside. Shit!
answer: Have you tried prising it off?

question: Wake up. We're at the beacon. Looks like trouble. Used one of these before?
answer: Fabrique Nationale tactical autoloader. Uses twelve mill hollow 'O' rounds, with through the barrel smart laser-sighting. Sure, I can handle this.

question: Okay. Watch were you point it... Yeah. Somebody won.
answer: Check out the tent.

question: I've found Ackland!
answer: Hold on...

question: Jesus palomino... Wait a minute, Doc...
answer: Is this it?

question: Yeah. Found it curled up in a corner of the tent. Any idea?
answer: Never come across one of these before. Maybe the original survey team did. I'll run it through records and see what comes up.

question: Hey, Jan. See if you can get someone to check out the chopper.
answer: What's the problem?

question: She was running a little sluggish on the way back. Think the turbines might be playing up.
answer: Give me twenty minutes and I'll do it myself.

question: I'm going to need you to co-sign the report. Until we come up with something, this'll be treated as first degree murder.
answer: Agreed.

question: When we get the link back, and I send this in, I.C.C.'ll throw a fit.
answer: Ah, don't worry about I.C.C. They're the least of your problems right now.

question: What did York say?
answer: York's vanished.

question: Vanished?
answer: Beauvais and Minh are dead, Ackland. York's gone awol, unless you can help us go some way toward disproving our suspicion, he's the prime suspect right now.

question: What's the matter, girl? You smell something?
answer: Rhinos look a little antsy,

question: Yeah. Never seem 'em act like this before.
answer: Do you hear that?

question: Yeah...
answer: I don't believe it.

question: He looks in a bad way. Help me get him up to Infirmary.
answer: Wait a minute... Holy Mary...

question: Oh. Oh God...
answer: What is it?

question: It's nothing, Doc. Just a... touch of indigestion... something.
answer: Do you want a tablet?

question: Uh-huh.
answer: That sounds nasty. I'll give you a couple of Demazine. Better?

question: Yeah...
answer: Hold on, it's alright. I'm gonna give you a shot...

question: C'mon, man. One more sweep.
answer: One more sweep... one more sweep. I'm getting tired of one more fuckin' sweep. We're been lookin' for this thing for three days now, and found zip.

question: Ah, quit griping. Keeps you in shape doesn't it?
answer: Hey! I was in shape before we started doing this.

question: Listen to that...
answer: Listen to what?

question: That's what I mean. This is the quietest I've ever heard it. It's unnatural.
answer: De Vries?

question: Yeah?
answer: Next time you have a thought like that? Keep it to yourself.

question: Something spooking the rhinos?
answer: I dunno.

question: That's real peculiar behavior.
answer: Hey, Guttierez?

question: What?
answer: Take a look at this.

question: One of 'em must have escaped.
answer: That's impossible, man. This fence is high-tensile. The breaking tolerance'd stand up to the strain of a rhino, easy. I know, I put it up.

question: There's no way a rhino'd survive that drop.
answer: Goldsmith's gonna be plenty pissed at losing one of her babies.

question: That's a fact. Whoa, wait a minute...
answer: What?

question: How's it going?
answer: Yeah, 'Good Evening' to you, too. Today's party's finished their sweep, the relief team's out there now. Everybody else is either asleep or running shift in the auto-shop.

question: You should hit the sack, too.
answer: Nah, I'll stick it out for another hour or so.

question: What time's sundown?
answer: 'Bout five minutes.

question: Give me a yell is something happens.
answer: You got it, cowboy.

question: It's up there somewhere... Come on.
answer: What? Are you nuts? Just the two of us?

question: I've seen this mother, De Vries. We can bag it, no problem.
answer: Forget it, man.

question: C'mon De Vries. Think of the bonus.
answer: Fuck the bonus. I hate heights. You wouldn't get me up there even if it wasn't night. What the hell are you doing?

question: Hey, fair enough. If you won't come, I'll handle it myself.
answer: Wait a minute! Alright, okay. Look...

question: What?
answer: I'll come with you. But I'm going first...

question: Hold it, hold it...
answer: What's wrong?

question: I'm picking up another signal.
answer: What? Where?

question: Just behind us, over to the right.
answer: Can't see a thing. Are you sure?

question: Yeah, I... Wait. Lost it.
answer: How?

question: I dunno. Might be a glitch.
answer: Oh, man. That's no glitch!

question: It's alright, it's cool...
answer: Is it still moving?

question: We've got company! Shit, I'm dry! You're up!
answer: I'm jammed!

question: You're what?!
answer: It's locked solid...

question: Auto-shop?
answer: Auto-shop's sealed, but those boys are cut-off.

question: Has anybody talked to them?
answer: Not yet.

question: That sounds promising. Can we operate the crane from here?
answer: Nah. It's got programmable facilities, but it was never rigged for remote operation. Someone'd have to go up to the cab to get it up and running.

question: Which mean physically going outside.
answer: Yeah.

question: Is this the suit?
answer: Uh-huh.

question: Hiroko... They...they snapped my legs to fit... fit me in here. I don't...remember what happened next.
answer: What can I do?

question: I can... feel it moving around inside me. You've got to kill me.
answer: I... I can't!

question: You have to...
answer: No!

question: No!
answer: Columns of fire jet from fissures and openings inside the Pump Chamber, rippling across the adult QUEEN ALIEN and her hapless victims. She begins to SCREAM, flailing around atop her metal throne...
speaker2: INT. RYUSHI STATION - SEWER SYSTEM - PUMP CHAMBER

question: Come on! Come on!
answer: The alien numbers on the PREDATOR self-destruct readout inexorably count down...
speaker2: INT. RYUSHI STATION - SEWER SYSTEM - PUMP CHAMBER

question: C'mon! Jump!
answer: BROKEN TUSK's P.O.V. The grinning face of the young QUEEN gets suddenly closer as the heli- jet is propelled towards the metal structure. HIROKO pushes on the stick. The heli-jet pulls away...then tilts violently to one side, engines desperately trying to compensate. HIROKO wrestles the overtaxed controls.

question: Shit! In the back! In the back!
answer: BROKEN TUSK pulls out a pulse-rifle from the rear. He quickly takes stock of it.
